title: Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra - Maximum Resolution & Photorealism
excerpt: Explore Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra - the premium version offering 4MP resolution and raw photorealism mode for the most demanding creative projects.
content:
What is Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra?

Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra is the premium tier of Black Forest Labs' Flux model family. Designed for professionals who need the highest possible quality, it offers 4 megapixel resolution and a unique "raw mode" that pushes photorealism to new heights.

Key Features

4 Megapixel Resolution

While standard Flux 1.1 Pro generates images at 1024×1024, Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra can produce images up to 2048×2048 pixels natively. This means:

  • 4x more pixels than standard models
  • Print-ready resolution for large formats
  • More detail in complex scenes
  • Better quality when zooming into specific areas

Raw Photorealism Mode

The exclusive "raw mode" in Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra is specifically designed for photorealistic outputs. It produces images with:

  • Natural film grain and texture
  • Realistic depth of field effects
  • Authentic lighting characteristics
  • Minimal AI artifacts

Enhanced Detail Rendering

With its higher resolution capabilities, Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra excels at:

  • Fine textures (fabric, skin pores, wood grain)
  • Small text and intricate patterns
  • Detailed backgrounds
  • Complex multi-subject compositions

Technical Specifications

SpecificationValue
Maximum Resolution2048×2048 px (4MP)
ArchitectureRectified Flow Transformer
Generation Time~10-15 seconds
Supported ModesText-to-Image
Special FeaturesRaw Mode
DeveloperBlack Forest Labs

When to Use Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra

Print Production

If you're creating images for print, the 4MP resolution is essential:

  • Posters and large format prints
  • Magazine covers and editorial spreads
  • Product packaging
  • Exhibition materials

Stock Photography Replacement

The raw photorealism mode makes Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra perfect for:

  • Creating unique stock-photo-quality images
  • Product photography alternatives
  • Lifestyle imagery for websites
  • Editorial content

High-End Marketing

Premium brands benefit from:

  • Hero images for campaigns
  • Billboard and outdoor advertising
  • Luxury product visualization
  • Brand photography alternatives

Raw Mode Deep Dive

The raw mode in Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra deserves special attention. When enabled, it:

Mimics Real Photography

Images look like they were captured with a high-end camera rather than AI-generated. This includes:

  • Subtle lens characteristics
  • Natural color grading
  • Authentic bokeh in out-of-focus areas
  • Realistic noise patterns

Reduces AI Artifacts

Raw mode specifically targets and reduces common AI image issues:

  • Overly smooth skin ("plastic" look)
  • Unnatural symmetry
  • Repetitive patterns
  • Inconsistent lighting

Prompt Optimization for Ultra

Leverage the Resolution

Since you're paying for higher resolution, make the most of it:

"Extreme close-up macro photograph of a monarch butterfly wing, showing individual scales and color patterns, professional nature photography, shallow depth of field, morning dew droplets, 8K detail"

Use Raw Mode Keywords

To maximize the raw photorealism:

  • "shot on film"
  • "35mm photograph"
  • "raw unprocessed"
  • "natural lighting"
  • "candid photography"

Specify Camera Details

Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra responds well to camera specifications:

  • "shot on Canon EOS R5"
  • "85mm f/1.4 lens"
  • "medium format film"
  • "Hasselblad quality"

Flux 1.1 Pro vs Ultra Comparison

FeatureFlux 1.1 ProFlux 1.1 Pro Ultra
Max Resolution1024×10242048×2048
Raw ModeNoYes
Generation Time~5-8 sec~10-15 sec
Credits23
Best ForGeneral usePrint & premium

Using Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra on Pixelift

To access Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra on Pixelift:

  1. Open the AI Image Generator
  2. Click on the model selector
  3. Navigate to the "Quality" category
  4. Select "Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra"
  5. Enter your prompt (consider using raw mode keywords)
  6. Generate your high-resolution image

Each generation costs 3 credits - a premium over standard Flux 1.1 Pro, but justified by the significantly higher quality output.

Is Ultra Worth the Extra Credits?

Consider Flux 1.1 Pro Ultra if you:

  • Need print-quality resolution
  • Require maximum photorealism
  • Are creating hero images or key visuals
  • Want to minimize post-processing
  • Work in premium brand contexts

For everyday use, web graphics, or rapid iteration, standard Flux 1.1 Pro remains the better choice. But when quality is paramount, Ultra delivers.
